wiki.summary: “MELTDOWN,” a three-part track that sees the tempo of the track rising until it reaches its untimely climax and the end of part one, sees Travis Scott recruit Drake as they both rap about their superiority in the music industry while the artists give themselves a God-complex, fitting with the theme of the album which is against the Devil. In the first part of the track, Drake takes control as he raps with a cold and raspy cadence, sending subliminal shots to several artists such as Pharrell Williams and Pusha T. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “MELTDOWN,” a three-part track that sees the tempo of the track rising until it reaches its untimely climax and the end of part one, sees Travis Scott recruit Drake as they both rap about their superiority in the music industry while the artists give themselves a God-complex, fitting with the theme of the album which is against the Devil. In the first part of the track, Drake takes control as he raps with a cold and raspy cadence, sending subliminal shots to several artists such as Pharrell Williams and Pusha T. However, in the second part, Travis keeps a similar beat and cadence which is later switched in the third part as his rhythm is slowed down. Drake’s appearance on the album as teased by fans on Twitter who were given the chance by Travis to listen to the album prior to its release. Read more on Last.fm.
